subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Male and female voices joined to create one response?
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-2091030554-1200069922=:98394
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Bruce, you may want to also add that when they wait for those fragments they are in fact Mike and Lisa's voice not just any male or female voice.  They are ones that you identify as being theirs.
   
  Juli

mllejade <leongbabe@...> wrote:
          Thanks for the fast reply, Bruce! Definitely something to add to my 
notes for further examination.

Sharon

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday 
<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Sharon,
> 
> In my experience through research, most of the time mike will wait 
for a masculine fragment or signal
> and lisa will wait for a feminine one. I believe they try to answer 
in the apropriate gender so that I 
> don't get confused about who is answering. Sometimes I will get a 
response or message that is made 
> up of both male and female voices together, even in the same word 
sometimes but very rarely.
> 
> And I think when that occurs it's because they lose the particular 
fragment midstream and pick up 
> whatever is available at that instant to complete the message , 
word or phrase.
> 
> I hope this answers your question and please keep asking them. It 
forces me to formulate an answer
> and you to further your knowledge as a researcher. That's what it's 
all about.
> 
> Bruce
> Bruce Halliday 
> 
> 
> To: EVP-ITC@...: leongbabe@...: Fri, 11 Jan 2008 16:26:18 
+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Male and female voices joined to create one 
response?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Bruce,Is it common to receive a response comprised of a mixture of 
men and women sound bytes/voices (like I heard in this one)? My guess 
is that we hear predominantly male voices because they're more male 
radio announcers. Therefore, does the entity who announces herself to 
you as Lisa come through with a male voice at times (because those 
are the voices that she gets most of the time to formulate a 
response)? Please tell me if my reasoning here is way off 
base...Thanks,Sharon--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, EVP-
ITC@yahoogroups.com wrote:>> > Hello,> > This email message is a 
notification to let you know that> a file has been uploaded to the 
Files area of the EVP-ITC > group.> > File : /*Bruce RS files_1-2-
08/7B_WE DON'T HAVE THE RIGHT SIGNAL FOR CONTROLING THAT.wav > 
Uploaded by : bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@> > Description :
